conversation.text: If you enjoy horror movies, I would recommend "Eraserhead" (1977) directed by David Fincher. This movie follows Henry Spencer as he grapples with his own inner demons and the horrors of his industrial environment. The movie stars Jack Nance in the title role, Charlotte Stewart as Henry's angry girlfriend, Hal Landon Jr. as Henry's newly born mutant child, and many other talented actors who bring their characters to life on screen. "Eraserhead" is a masterful horror film that will keep you on the edge of your seat from beginning to end. It is a must-see for anyone who loves horror movies or any movie that challenges your beliefs and forces you to think deeply about the meaning of life, death, and everything in between.

I would recommend "The Wrestler" which is a biographical drama film based on the novel written by Frank Serpico. The movie tells the story of a wrestler who is struggling to find his place in life and how he eventually finds himself through his wrestling journey.
Another recommendation would be "Born on the Fourth of July" which is an American drama film directed by Oliver Stone and starring Russell Crowe, Denzel Washington, Kevin Costner, Tom Cruise, Tom Cruise, Wayne Knight. The movie tells the story of Ron Kovic, a Marine who returns from Vietnam with a broken heart, and how he eventually finds himself through his activism.
Another recommendation would be "Doctor Zhivago" which is a Russian drama film directed by Yuri Lavrentyev and starring Konstantin Stanislavov, Nadiya Kuznetsova, Vladimir Semikino, Leonid Popov, Viktor Mikhaylov. The movie tells the story of Doctor Zhivago, a Russian physician who falls in love with the wife of another political activist, but ultimately finds himself through his work as a physician.
